title: The Reason Olympian Chloe Kim’s Hair Looks So Effortless Is This $12 Dry Shampoo
text:
The Reason Olympian Chloe Kim’s Hair Looks So Effortless Is This $12 Dry Shampoo

There are several reasons why finding the right dry shampoo is a tricky feat. For starters, it’s not guaranteed that it will actually help your hair feel cleaner and absorb excess oil — and that’s not even taking into consideration whether or not it’ll leave a chalky cast in its wake. And if there’s one person who feels uniquely primed to put the stuff through its paces, it’s Chloe Kim.

The Olympic snowboarder — who the world met in the 2018 Winter Games as a bleached blonde — has recently returned to her brunette roots. Given that her job requires more time in a snug, sweat-trapping helmet than the average person, when she says she swears by Batiste to keep her roots feeling and looking fresh, I — a fellow dark brunette — am inclined to believe her.

“I remember using Batiste for the first time and being like, oh my gosh, this works,” she tells Refinery29, days before going to intensive training ahead of the upcoming 2026 Olympics in Italy. “Especially with my travel and training, it’s one of those necessities that I need on the go.” Her favorite formula? The Zen Matcha Light Dry Shampoo, which uses rice starch to mop up excess oil and has a refreshing chamomile, green tea, and sandalwood scent.

Keep reading as Kim divulges her Olympics hair routine, the K-beauty find she’s currently obsessed with, and more.

DashDividers_1_500x100

On her favorite skincare of the moment 

“My skincare routine these days consists of Medicube,” Kim tells me — and it makes total sense considering the brand’s toner pads have become a cult staple among K-beauty obsessives and R29 staffers alike. “I love their toner pads and face masks, especially the collagen masks,” adds Kim.  For her, that reliability becomes essential when she’s travelling: “When I’m on the road, especially for snowboarding, where I’m in very dry climates, it’s all about moisturize, moisturize, moisturize.” We love Medicube’s Collagen Niacinamide Jelly Cream for its glass skin-bestowing ingredients like collagen, squalane, and niacinamide.

DashDividers_1_500x100

On her Olympics hair routine

Kim’s secret to excellent hair is practice — and then some. “Honestly, it’s like muscle memory at this point. I just know where to pull from,” she says of her accidentally perfect strands. “I will say when I sleep with heatless curls in, I get a really cute wave. So when I pull my strands out, they’re perfect.” To make the most of your beauty sleep, try Kitsch’s Satin Heatless Curling Set, which cuts down on frizz and breakage while delivering bouncy, defined ringlets.

Kim laughs as she thinks back to her early snowboarding days, when bigger always felt better. “I used to like [my waves] really thick,” she adds, “so I’d pull out a pretty big chunk, but then it started obstructing my vision when I was doing tricks, so I had to tone it back a bit.”

DashDividers_1_500x100

On her experimenting with beauty

Looking back on her beauty routine throughout the years, Kim — whose signature look is a matte nude lip and feathered brows — says she’s switched things up so many times. “I got into makeup when I was young, and then hair came shortly after. I wanted to dye it all these crazy colors and do all of that fun stuff — I’m all about it. When I first started doing makeup, I always had to have eyeliner, usually a little wing. I also loved mascara and got into BB cushions too.” (One of her go-to’s is the Laneige Neo Cushion, which packs hydrating properties and sheer coverage in a light-as-air formula].

DashDividers_1_500x100

On returning to her brunette roots

While Kim might be known for her incredible hair today, the journey getting there wasn’t exactly smooth sailing. “Bleaching was rough for my hair, I’m not going to lie. I had to chop it when it was bleached, which was sad, but when I went back to brunette, I was able to grow it out, and I started caring more about my hair when I saw that it was growing back very healthy.” Kim says that it’s about having a consistent routine, but mainly, taking care of your scalp. “My scalp was always so oily and congested, and I would wash it all the time. And then that’s when I discovered Batiste dry shampoo,” she says. The Zen Matcha Light Dry Shampoo buys you more time between washes — ideal if you’re as busy as Kim — thanks to oil-absorbing rice starch. It’s also packed with moisturizing glycerin and calming plant extracts to keep your scalp healthy and comfortable.

Like what you see? How about some more R29 goodness, right here?

title: Your December Tarotscope Is Basically a Sneak Peek at 2026
text:
Your December Tarotscope Is Basically a Sneak Peek at 2026 December opens a prophetic window for us. It is a transitional pause and an opportunity to integrate all the lessons we’ve gathered throughout the year and lock it in before moving onto the new year portal. Here we get to rest, recalibrate our energies, and focus on setting intentions for the new year. It is a moment between endings and beginnings, and if we are silent enough, we can hear Spirit’s whispers on what’s next. 

This month’s tarotscopes reveal the frequency you’ll be walking into in 2026: the blessings you’ve earned, the lessons that are wrapping up, and the energy that will define your next chapter. You are always the energetic architect of your present and future. Now allow these tarotscopes to guide you toward alignment.

title: The Super Cold Moon In Gemini Is The Vibe Shift We’ve Been Waiting For
text:
The Super Cold Moon In Gemini Is The Vibe Shift We’ve Been Waiting For

As we come nearer to closing out 2025, the Cold Moon in Gemini on December 4th serves up some positivity for us all in the midst of Sagittarius season — putting us in an excellent mindset. In short: It is the vibe shift we’ve been waiting for. 

This is the second-to-last supermoon in the series; the next one occurs on January 3rd 2026. A supermoon occurs when the moon is in proximity to the earth in parity. When this happens, we feel the effects of illumination more deeply and intensely as the moon appears to be fuller, brighter, and shinier.

The last Full Moon of 2025 is asking us to make crucial decisions before New Year. We are torn between two different directions, offering us the chance to evolve or stay the same. The caveat is that we may not be ready to move forward, as numerous loose ends need to be addressed. These issues have been swept under the rug because we’ve been lost in a sea of emotions this past month, when five planets were retrograde, tugging at our heartstrings and making us yearn for the past. It’s no wonder we’ve been in a haze.

As we dust off the stale vibes, the Full Moon calls upon us to be more open with our emotions and discuss them with others. Since the Nodes of Destiny are squaring the lunation, we need to be ready to state our opinions. There can be issues in communication, causing problems with others. Still, if we mentally grow and use this opportunity to be more direct and not hold back, then we will be able to move past the internal conflict and tension that we are feeling. Letting go of our old patterns will be challenging, and we may fluctuate throughout the process. It’ll take a minute, even though we are starting the journey now.

Keep in mind that Mercury is still in its “retroshade” phase since the planet ended its retrograde on November 29th. Mercury is still dealing with situations brought on by the retrograde until December 16th, when it clears the post-shadow zone. As a result, we may still be dealing with issues from then, as Mercury is revisiting that timeline. Therefore, it’s essential to think before speaking and not act impulsively, as there may be sensitivities that others feel, including ourselves. Being kind and compassionate is always crucial in times like these, especially since the mutable Supermoon takes on the sentiments of those surrounding them.

Remember that three planets are currently moonwalking in the sky: Jupiter in Cancer, Uranus in Taurus, and Neptune in Pisces. While they don’t have an intense or immense impact on us, they’ll reveal the motives of others. They are helping us to understand the importance of living our best lives — no matter what’s gone down in the recent past. The future seems to be prosperous and infinite, giving us an optimistic push toward our aspirations.

This energy is highlighted by the presence of the star Cursa (fixed stars add seasoning to the flavor of planets), which plays an important role during this lunation. Being that Cursa is beneficial and lucky, we’ll be able to get through problems without a hitch. The universe is offering us the opportunity to enhance our fortune by giving us an abundance of love and kindness. Cursa is making us extremely sociable and wanting to connect with others. Beware that it can unlock scandals, so don’t repeat rumors that may or may not be valid. 

Even though things may seem grim before the Full Moon, the energy will give us the motivation to tap into the power within ourselves. This is an opportunity for us to make things better — especially for ourselves and those we care about.

Like what you see? How about some more R29 goodness, right here?

Sagittarius Season Is Here

title: H&M Collabs With Perfect Moment On An Après-Ski Winter Collection
text:
H&M Collabs With Perfect Moment On An Après-Ski Winter Collection

Amid all the Cyber Monday sales, gift season frenzy, and new holiday collection drops, the shopping landscape may feel like an avalanche of too many new and shiny things to cart up. But we’re briefly plowing back all of that to shine a light on H&M’s latest (and coveted) collaboration. This time, the reader-favorite retailer has teamed up with luxury ski and lifestyle brand Perfect Moment on an après-ski-inspired winter collection. 

“Après-ski has always had a certain energy: relaxed, comfortable, social, playful, and glamourous,” said Perfect Moment co-founder and creative director Jane Gottschalk, in a press release. “Together [with H&M], we’ve curated a collection that brings the spirit of both brands to life. The pieces are young, fun, [and] sporty, with a winter heartbeat and a nod to the mountains, but belong just as much in the city.” 

The 28-piece capsule collection spans versatile knitwear, down-filled outerwear, and statement accessories — like cozy hats and puffer boots — in a chic winter color palette of black, white, silver, rich burgundy, and icy blue.

“We’re thrilled to be collaborating with Perfect Moment on this winter collection — it’s unexpected, dynamic, and sure to spark excitement,” said H&M creative advisor and head of womenswear design, Ann-Sofie Johansson, in the release. “The silhouettes are glamorous yet laid-back — just like après-ski — but also have a real edge with the leather, faux fur, and textured knits.”

From down puffer jackets, mohair gloves, knit balaclavas, and polarized sunglasses you might actually wear on the slopes to matching sets, merino-wool sweaters, faux-fur boots, and trapper hats you’d wear around a ski lodge (or to simply channel après-ski energy), the collection has a range of functional and fashionable pieces.

And in addition to oversized hoods, waist-cinching toggles, jacquard trims, and pom-poms, Perfect Moment’s signature North Star logo is dotted across all the styles. “The North Star sits at the heart of the brand and part of our DNA — a constant from the inception of the brand in the 80s,” said Gottschalk. “It represents direction, focus, and the idea of finding your own way […] a reminder of where we started and where we’re heading.”

So whether you’re heading to the bunny slopes or your local café for hot chocolate, H&M’s newest collection with Perfect Moment is on its way to dress you up this winter season.

Shop full H&M x Perfect Moment collection on December 2 at 10 a.m. EST.

title: Medik8 Is Having A Huge Sale — Here’s What A Beauty Editor Would Buy
text:
Medik8 Is Having A Huge Sale — Here’s What A Beauty Editor Would Buy

This Black Friday and Cyber Monday, editor-favorite skincare brand Medik8 is offering 30% off sitewide from November 20 through December 2.

As a beauty and shopping writer, I’ve spent countless hours interviewing dermatologists and estheticians, picking their brains for skincare advice and the beauty products they’d happily spend their hard-earned money on. Whenever I ask for recommendations on how to build an effective, no-nonsense routine, one brand comes up time and again: Medik8.

There’s a good reason why this British skincare brand has captured the attention of so many in-the-know experts. The brand is most beloved for its Crystal Retinal range, which offers retinal (a vitamin A derivative targeting uneven skin texture and pigmentation) at various concentrations. This tailored approach allows you to find the retinoid strength that works best for your skin without irritation. Other Medik8 products, such as the vitamin C serums and ceramide moisturizers, are also highly rated for their efficacy.

Since Medik8 is currently offering 30% off sitewide until December 2, we couldn’t help but share the bestselling products we’ll be carting up during this major Black Friday beauty sale.

DashDividers_1_500x100

Medik8 Crystal Retinal 3, $65 $45.50

As someone who has sensitive skin, a product that doesn’t cause an instant uncomfortable reaction is a keeper for Susan Devaney, Refinery29’s lifestyle director. Enter: Medik8 Crystal Retinal 3. “I use it twice a week at night, and I honestly notice my skin feeling softer and brighter when I wake the following day,” she says. Devaney adds, “I’m aware that retinal [a form of vitamin A that’s more gentle but faster-acting than retinol] helps to keep skin in better shape by targeting hyperpigmentation and uneven skin tone. I’m in my 30s, so this feels like a good investment to make for my future self. I apply SPF to my skin daily, too, which is a must when using any retinal product.”

Shop Medik8

DashDividers_1_500x100

Medik8 Total Moisture Daily Facial Cream, $49 $34.30

Refinery29’s beauty director Jacqueline Kilikita used this moisturizer down to the very last drop, and while this might not seem like an impressive feat, for a beauty editor whose job it is to try everything all at once, it says something about how excellent it is. “I love the cushiony texture that sits somewhere between a gel and a cream; it quenches my parched patches in seconds, all without leaving behind a greasy or tacky residue,” says Kilikita. The star ingredients are peptides (essentially skin-strengthening proteins), hydrating hyaluronic acid, and ceramides, which act like glue in between skin cells to keep them healthy and happy. “For me, ceramides are a must when I choose a moisturizer, especially in the winter when my skin becomes sensitive to cold weather and central heating,” adds Kilikita. Even better? It doesn’t break her out like other face creams. She’s already on her third tub.

Shop Medik8

DashDividers_1_500x100

Medik8 C-Tetra Serum, $49 $34.30

Lots of vitamin C serums leave skin feeling itchy and red, but Medik8’s C-Tetra is built differently. It contains 7% tetrahexyldecyl ascorbate, a stabilized form of vitamin C that doesn’t irritate, and is enriched with nourishing jojoba oil. Reviewers praise this serum for making a difference to their skin’s overall radiance and improving dark spots. The texture is akin to a dry facial oil and feels a lot more moisturizing than most serums.

Shop Medik8

DashDividers_1_500x100

Medik8 Surface Radiance Cleanse, $27 $18.90

This gel cleanser was recommended to Refinery29’s beauty director by a dermatologist when she was going through a period of hormonal acne, and she is convinced it helped to clear up her skin. The reason it’s so great for spots is that it boasts exfoliating alpha hydroxy acids (AHAs) like lactic acid and beta hydroxy acids (BHAs) like salicylic acid. The former chips away at dead skin cells and minimizes the appearance of hyperpigmentation, while the latter goes a little deeper, breaking up the mixture of dead cells, oil, and dirt that clogs pores. While it sounds powerful, it’s actually very gentle and never dries out the skin thanks to a heavy helping of moisturizing glycerin.

Shop Medik8

DashDividers_1_500x100

Medik8 Liquid Peptides Serum, $66 $46.20

Celebrity dermatologist Dr. Ewoma Ukeleghe once described Liquid Peptides as ‘Botox in a bottle,’ and we couldn’t agree with her more. The star ingredient is a hefty 30% concentration of 10 peptides. If you’re unfamiliar with peptides, they’re essentially proteins that boost collagen and elastin — the two things responsible for keeping skin supple. Despite these powerhouse ingredients, it’s surprisingly lightweight and absorbs quickly. Apply it in the evening and wake up to bouncy skin.

Shop Medik8

DashDividers_1_500x100

Medik8 Lipid-Balance Cleansing Oil, $38 $26.60

This oil cleanser emulsifies on contact with water, turning into a silky milk that dissolves everything from multiple coats of mascara to heavy foundation and sunscreen — all without drying out your skin. That’s thanks to the mega mix of omega-6, vitamin E, and plant extracts that nourish the delicate skin barrier rather than strip it. There’s a reason beauty editors always fall back on it.

Shop Medik8

DashDividers_1_500x100

Medik8 Hydr8 B5 Liquid Rehydration Serum, $54 $37.80

This isn’t your average hyaluronic acid serum. It uses multi-weight hyaluronic acid, which penetrates at different levels to ensure every layer of your skin is properly hydrated. Beyond HA, it features a solid dose of vitamin B5 (also known as panthenol) — an ingredient dermatologists praise for helping lock moisture in. Dry, dehydrated skin? Don’t know her. Better still, it never leaves skin feeling greasy or sticky.

Shop Medik8

DashDividers_1_500x100

Medik8 H.E.O. Mask, $68 $47.60

This two-step mask is a saviour for dry winter skin — just don’t let the duo of products put you off. It’s meant to be a ritual. It contains a trifecta of moisturizing ingredients: humectants, which draw moisture into the skin; occlusives, which keep it there; and emollients, which soothe and soften dry, flaky skin. Even after one use of layering the two, you’ll notice that your skin looks fresher and noticeably less parched.

Shop Medik8

title: 15 Festive Short Nail Designs You’ll Actually Wear This Christmas
text:
15 Festive Short Nail Designs You’ll Actually Wear This Christmas

As if the festive season wasn’t busy enough, nail artists everywhere face a gargantuan task: dreaming up countless holiday-ready designs to carry clients through Thanksgiving, Christmas, and New Year celebrations. But if Instagram is anything to go by, nail techs seem to favor longer talons to show off their work. While the canvas might be bigger, why shouldn’t short nails get in on the fun, too?

If you’re giving extensions a break this season, click ahead for our roundup of the best short Christmas nail ideas — so cute, you’ll want to wear them well into 2026.

DashDividers_1_500x100

Starry Sprigs

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Els Gels™ | Nail Salon | Training Academy | Welded Jewellery (@elsgels)

Els Gels has reimagined the holly tree with forest-green tips and berry-red stars, set on a nude base so the design can do all the talking.

Delicate Chrome Details

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by 𝐦𝐢𝐚 𝐟𝐚𝐫𝐫𝐞𝐥𝐥𝐲 | 𝐦𝐚𝐧𝐜𝐡𝐞𝐬𝐭𝐞𝐫 𝐧𝐚𝐢𝐥 𝐭𝐞𝐜𝐡 (@bymiaf)

Mia Farrelly shows that Christmas nails don’t have to be over-the-top to make an impact. This dainty bow and curved-line detailing get festive with a subtle dusting of gold chrome powder.

Cranberry Snowflakes

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Shelley Graham (@_by_shelley)

Shelley Graham makes another case for chrome — this time in a bold red — layered over delicate, hand-painted snowflakes that bring a nude nail to life.

Festive Plaid

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by HannaGuru | Content Creator | Hand Model (@hannaguru)

Plaid is arguably the most-requested nail design of the season, and it’s easy to see why. This glitter-and-block-color mashup on a nude base is reminiscent of a gift ribbon. Props to content creator HannaGuru on Instagram.

Yultide Sparkle

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Stop The Lights (@stopthelights)

This manicure by Stop The Lights mixes a glitter base with metallic flecks and reflective sparkle for the most fun nails we’ve seen this side of winter. 

Gold On Gold

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by She Love Nail Studio •Hazel Gisbeth• (@shelovenailstudio)

Created by Hazel Gisbeth at She Love Nail Studio, these molten gold dots on an equally shiny, glittery gold base scream party season.

Cranberry Frenchies

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Jess Beard – Shrewsbury Nail Technician (@jmbmanicures)

Sometimes a simple French tip is all you need to get into the festive spirit. Take inspiration from nail artist Jess Beard and choose a milky nude base to offset the cranberry red.

Short Maximalist

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Diana Smith | Utah Licensed Nail Tech (@polished.by.diana)

Nail art isn’t reserved for long nails, as nail technician Diana Smith proves here. We love this festive, holly- and mistletoe-inspired set.

With A Bow

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by 𝐦𝐢𝐚 𝐟𝐚𝐫𝐫𝐞𝐥𝐥𝐲 | 𝐦𝐚𝐧𝐜𝐡𝐞𝐬𝐭𝐞𝐫 𝐧𝐚𝐢𝐥 𝐭𝐞𝐜𝐡 (@bymiaf)

What’s not to love about this festive set by Mia Farrelly? The glitter bauble and French tip are accented with chrome gold details in the shape of a bow and snowflake.

Christmas Confetti

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by 𝙼𝚘𝚗𝚒𝚔𝚊 𝙼𝚊𝚢𝚎𝚛 (@monmayernails)

This Christmas confetti manicure by Monika Mayer features stars and flecks that catch the light from every angle.

Candy Cane Stripes

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by TAYLOR 🪩🫧✨ (@islasnailsandbeauty)

It wouldn’t be Christmas without a candy cane print. This ultra-shiny pink and red design by Taylor at @islasnailsandbeauty is finished with a delicate holly sprig for extra festive cheer.

Velvet Ribbon

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Maisie Jackson Beauty (@maisiejacksonbeauty)

This teal cat-eye polish with star-embellished accent nails evokes the look of the perfect gift, wrapped in velvet bows and gem-encrusted paper.

Frosted Details

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Guzsván Cintia (@nail_art_by_cintia)

Created by Guzsván Cintia, this midnight blue glitter base with snowflake details looks like they’re drifting down from the night sky.

Mulled Wine Stars

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by 𝓙𝓜 𝓝𝓪𝓲𝓵𝓼 & 𝓑𝓮𝓪𝓾𝓽𝔂 (@nails_birmingham_uk)

JM Nails’ mulled wine base, topped with gold glitter stars, makes for the ultimate festive manicure on short nails.

title: The 55 Best Christmas Movies To Get You Into The Festive Spirit
text:

Whatever you're looking for — a cheesy rom-com to play in the background while you ice some gingerbread people, a thrilling Christmas horror with an edge, a Christmas musical that'll have you singing along, or you only want to see Vanessa Hudgens in another outlandish Christmas film, we've got you covered.

title: 7 Christmas Gems On Netflix To Get You In The Holiday Spirit
text:
7 Christmas Gems On Netflix To Get You In The Holiday Spirit

I look forward to December every year, simply for the chance to sit in the lounge and binge Christmas movies. I love the classics, from Home Alone to Love Actually, but there’s always a new set of films that appear on Netflix. The streamer has come out with some gems over the past few years, like Love Hard, Hot Frosty and Klaus, so I’ve been eagerly awaiting their holiday slate.

From Alicia Silverstone’s new A Merry Little Ex-Mas to Jingle Bell Heist, there’s some great festive options to pull up on your screen. If you prefer lifestyle shows over movies, Meghan Markle has conjured up a special holiday edition of her show With Love, Meghan. To take a look at the best Christmas content coming to Netflix, read on.

DashDividers_1_500x100

A Merry Little Ex-Mas

After Kate (Alicia Silverstone) and Everett (Oliver Hudson) decide to “consciously uncouple”, the exes must navigate one last perfect family Christmas together before moving on. With the addition of some younger flings (Jameela Jamil and Pierson Fode), chaos ensues and nothing goes to plan.

When: Streaming now
Watch if you like: Hot Frosty, Our Little Secret

DashDividers_1_500x100

Champagne Problems

When American hotshot Sydney (Minka Kelly) heads to France to acquire a Champagne brand, she ends up falling for Henri (Tom Wozniczka) during one magical night. Everything comes crumbling down when it’s revealed that Henri is the son of the Champagne brand, and they’re suddenly at odds.

When: Streaming now
Watch if you like: Last Christmas, Meet Me Next Christmas

DashDividers_1_500x100

Jingle Bell Heist

Jingle Bell Heist shot to number one on Netflix’s most-watched movies list just hours after it was released, it’s one to watch. The film follows Sophia (Olivia Holt) and Nick (Connor Swindells) as they reluctantly join forces to rob one of London’s biggest department stores. As their romance starts to develop, will the heist be put into jeopardy?

When: Streaming now
Watch if you like: Love Hard, Holidate

DashDividers_1_500x100

My Secret Santa

The premise of My Secret Santa sounds cheesy in the best way. After a single mum (Alexandra Breckenridge) finds herself in desperate need of a job, she disguises herself as Santa and starts working at a luxury ski resort. Her plan seems to work out perfectly, until she starts falling in love with the hotel manager (Ryan Eggold).

When: December 3
Watch if you like: Love Hard, Holidate

DashDividers_1_500x100

With Love, Meghan: Holiday Celebration

Meghan Markle is back with a special holiday edition of With Love, Meghan. She’ll be joined by her celebrity friends as she shows how to craft gifts, decorate her home and create holiday dishes.

When: December 3
Watch if you like: With Love, Meghan, The Cook-A-Long

DashDividers_1_500x100

Man Vs. Baby

Trevor Bingley (Rowan Atkinson) is back, and plans to have a relaxing holiday season while housesitting a luxury penthouse in London. However, his life gets upended when he finds himself having to look after an unclaimed baby.

When: December 11
Watch if you like: Man Vs. Bee, Mr Bean

DashDividers_1_500x100

Meet Me Next Christmas

While not technically new, Meet Me Next Christmas is an instant holiday classic that flew too under-the-radar when it dropped in 2024. It’s about a woman named Layla (Christina Milian) who is on a quest to meet James, the man of her dreams (Kofi Siriboe), so she races across New York City with a Christmas concierge (Devale Ellis) hoping to find a ticket to a sold-out Pentatonix Christmas concert.

When: Streaming now
Watch if you like: The Holiday Calendar, Operation Christmas Drop

title: Final Chance! Your Guide To The Best Cyber Monday Deals
text:
Final Chance! Your Guide To The Best Cyber Monday Deals

Every year, it seems like Black Friday and Cyber Monday sales simply aren’t what they were. In 2025, that’s not necessarily the case anymore though. Through our hours of extensive research, we’ve found the best Cyber Monday deals and can confirm the discounts are discounting!. But you still have to shuffle through quite a bit of noise. This is the Super Bowl of online shopping after all, and we’re here to set you up for the ultimate success.

Expect major savings this year, going up to 80% off everything from mattresses to beauty devices, sex toys, designer items, and more. If you’re feeling overwhelmed by the sheer volume of sales happening, our organized list below is here to help. Think of it as a personalized roadmap to the best promos available now, helping you score a handful of shopping touchdowns this Cyber Monday.

Ahead, we rounded up the must-see markdowns from reader-favorite brands like Wayfair, Everlane, Nordstrom, Mejuri, Lelo, and more — most of which end tonight. So, grab your laptop, a snack, and a credit card. Get in reader, we’re going (online) shopping!

DashDividers_1_500x100

Best Cyber Monday Mattress & Bedding Sales

Up to 20% off at Avocado

Shoppers can get up to 20% off organic mattresses at Avocado through December 8, no code needed.

Up to 35% off at Casper

No code is needed for Casper’s Cyber Monday bonanza. The brand is offering up to 35% off mattresses and bundles.

Up to 35 off at Cozy Earth

There’s a special promo code for our readers at the bedding and loungewear brand. Enter code REFINERY29 for 35% off until December 31.

Up to 40% at Doze

The brand, known for its duvets, is offering different percentages off its categories. Duvet covers and inserts will be 30% off while bundles will be on sale for 40% off.

Up to 35% off at Ostermoor

The bedding brand is offering up to 35% off its best selling mattresses and 30% off items like its duvet.

25% off at Parachute

Through Cyber Monday, take 25% off all bedding and accessories, and up to 70% off sale styles.

Up to $800 off at Purple

The bedding brand is offering up to $800 off mattresses, including its higher end models through December 8.

Up to $625 off Saatva mattresses

Through Cyber Monday, save more when you spend more, plus save an extra $100 when you purchase any adjustable base or upholstered bed frame with a mattress.

DashDividers_1_500x100

Best Cyber Monday Fashion Sales

Up to 50% off Abercrombie & Fitch

Take between 25% and 50% off almost everything through December 1, no code needed.

Extra 40% off Adidas

Through December 3, take an extra 40% off full-price and sale items, with some exclusions, with code CYBER.

Up to 50% off Alohas shoes

The Spanish-born fashion brand has select footwear styles, from sneakers to ballet flats, on sale for up to 50% through Cyber Monday.

Up to 15% off Angara

Through December 1, the jeweler is offering 12% off orders over $500 and 15% off orders over $1,999. Shoppers can receive a free jewelry gift with every purchase when using the code GIFTANGARA.

Up to 50% off at Anthropologie

Take an extra 50% off sale styles at Anthropologie for a limited time during Cyber Monday. Plus, take 30% off select clothing, home decor and furniture, and gifts.

Up to 50% off at Aritzia

Aritzia’s “Black Fiveday Sale” runs through December 2 and features between 20% and 50% off everything. The brand’s popular Super Puff will also be discounted. No code is needed.

Up to 50% off at Bogg

Known for its hole-y tote bag, Bogg is offering 25% off sitewide until December 1. Its sports collection gets a higher markup, on sale for 50% off through Cyber Monday.

Up to 60% off Brandon Blackwood

The New York-based accessories brand will have its entire site on sale up to 60% off following Black Friday. Starting December 1, full-price items will be 15% off, no code needed.

Up to 40% off at Coach

The brand is offering 40% off select styles on Cyber Monday, including its Gramercy totes and Tabby bags.

Up to 40% off Cos

The brand will have up to 40% off select styles on Cyber Monday, online only, no code necessary.

Up to 50% Off Everlane

Get up to 50% off all styles at Everlane through November 30. Starting December 1, the sale will add an extra promo with 40% off of sweaters.

40% off Free People sale styles

For Cyber Monday, take an additional 40% off all Free People sale styles across fashion.

Up to 30% off at Heaven Mayhem

The celebrity-loved brand has its items, from earrings to Cartier-esque watches, on sale at 30% off until December 2. Shoppers also get a gift with their purchase after spending $100.

Up to 50% off J.Crew

Take 50% off your J.Crew purchase on Cyber Monday, no code needed. There’s also 30% off cashmere, chinos, and suiting, with an extra 60% off sale styles.

25% off Jennifer Behr

Take 25% off orders of $150 or more sitewide, with no exclusions, through December 2.

25% off at Jenny Bird

The jeweler is offering 25% off sitewide through December 1. Shoppers will get a free gift with their purchase, while supplies last. The promotion excludes fine jewelry, and no code is needed.

Up to 50% off Kate Spade

For a limited time, take up to 50% off Kate Spade purses and more —including new arrivals — with some exclusions.

Up to 60% off at Knix 

The brand, known for its period underwear, has a sitewide sale through December 2 with items up to 60% off. Its most popular period undies and bras are included in the sale.

Up to 40% off Lululemon

For one day only, take up to 40% off select Lululemon styles, including rare deals.

Up to 70% off M.Gemi

The Italian footwear brand is offering 30% off its shoes for Cyber Monday, with sale items up to a whopping 70% off.

Up to 50% off Mango

On Cyber Monday only, take up to 50% off select clothing, jewelry, and accessories.

Up to 30% off at Mejuri

The jewelry brand is offering shoppers up to 30% off until December 1 on minimum purchases of $150. Higher end pieces like its serpentine chain necklace in white gold will be on sale for 30% off.

30% off at Melissa

Get 30% off sitewide at the accessories brand until December 3.

Up to 50% off at Monica Vinader

The British jeweler is offering up to 50% off through December 4 with surprise flash sales until then.

Up to 50% Net-a-Porter 

Take up to 50% off select styles at the luxury retailer on Cyber Monday.

Up to 70% off at Nordstrom Rack; up to 60% off at Nordstrom

Nordstrom Rack is offering up to 70% off online and in store across big box brands and indie labels alike. Plus, it’s offering an extra 40% off clearance. The sale runs through December 2. Nordstrom is offering up to 60% off brands like Barbour, Ugg, Veronica Beard, TT Studios, and more through December 3.

40% off at Outdoor Voices

Through Cyber Monday, take 40% off sitewide, and shop additional markdowns on OV Extra styles.

Limited-time deals at Quince

For one day only, shop rare deals across clothing, jewelry, fragrances, luggage, bedding, furniture, and more.

25% off at Reformation

For Cyber Monday, Reformation is offering 25% off everything, including its leather boots and cashmere sweaters.

Up to 50% off Saks Fifth Avenue

The retailer is offering $50 off every $200 shoppers spend with the code CYBRRSF. This promo runs through December 3.

Up to 25% off Shopbop

With the code HOLIDAY, Shopbop customers can get 25% off thousands of items on Cyber Monday.

Up to 50% off at Sperry

The shoemaker, known for its iconic boat shoe and winter boots, has up to 50% off sale styles until December 2. Regular-priced styles get 20% off.

Up to 25% off at Theory

Shop Theory at 25% off the majority of its items through Cyber Monday, including its cashmere sweaters and winter coats.

Up to 55% off at Vionic

The shoe brand will have select styles on sale for up to 55% off select styles starting December 1.

Up to 30% off Vivaia

Through December 2, take 20% off two pairs, 25% off three pairs, or 30% off four pairs with the code BFCM25.

DashDividers_1_500x100

Best Cyber Monday Beauty Sales

Up to 40% off Beauty of Joseon

The K-beauty brand, beloved for its sunscreen and skincare, is offering up to 40% off its items until December 1, via Amazon.

Up to 40% Biodance

The skincare brand, known for its face masks, is offering up to 40% off all its products on Amazon for Cyber Monday.

35% off Bloomeffects

The tulip-power skincare brand is hosting a 35% off sale across its products through December 2. Shoppers must use the code BLOOMVIP35 to receive the discount. Those who spend over $100 will also receive a gift.

Up to 30% off Dr. Dennis Gross Skincare

The skincare brand, loved by beauty enthusiasts for its formulas and devices, is offering 30% sitewide until December 2, with some exclusions like kits. Its LED devices are on sale for 20% off.

Up to 25% off at Dyson

Through December 1, the brand will have several of its most popular hair tools on sale at $100 off each. This includes the Dyson Airwap and Airstrait.

50% off Fresh bestsellers

For a limited time, take 50% off bestsellers and 30% off the rest of the site.

Up to 30 off Jupiter on Amazon

The anti-dandruff haircare brand has its products up to 30% off through December 1 via Amazon.

Up to 25% off La Roche-Posay on Amazon

The skincare label is having a brand-wide sale on Amazon through December 1, where select products will be 25% off. This includes some of its customer favorites, like its cleansing oil, sunscreen, and vitamin C serum.

Up to 31% off Medicube

The K-beauty brand, known for its skincare devices, will have discounts up to 31% off through Cyber Monday. Its popular Booster Pro tool will be on sale for $150, while other skincare products will go sub $20. 

20% off at Merit Beauty

Through December 1, Merit Beauty is hosting its only sale of the year with 20% off sitewide. The brand is also offering a gift with purchases during this time.

Up to 25% off Nécessaire

For a limited time, take up to 25% off select items. Plus, get a free lip balm on all orders while supplies last.

Up to 50% off select beauty at Sephora

Through December 1, Sephora’s Cyber Week deal offers up to 50% off select beauty products from brands like Laneige, Rare Beauty, and Paula’s Choice.

25% off at Sulwhasoo

The brand is offering 25% off sitewide starting December 1. The promotion includes its sets, and if you spend over $350, there’s a six-piece gift with purchase.

25% off at Tatcha

Take up to 25% off sitewide with code CYBER25 through Cyber Monday. Plus, choose free gifts with purchases of $100 or more.

Up to 50% off at The Doux

The haircare brand, which works on all hair types and is specially formulated for textured hair, is offering 30% off purchases under $50, 40% off purchases over $50, and 20% off sitewide until December 6. No code is needed.

25% off Victoria Beckham Beauty

Today only, take 25% off sitewide, automatically applied in cart with some exclusions.

Up to 40% off at Ulta

The beauty retailer’s Cyber Monday bonanza runs until December 1 with over 400 items up to 40% off. Entire brands like Beyonce’s Cecred, Ulta’s in-house brands, and Tarte will be on sale for 30% off.

DashDividers_1_500x100

Best Cyber Monday Home & Tech Sales

Up to 20% off at Flamingo Estate

The brand is offering 20% off sitewide until December 2, which includes most items, like its popular tomato candle.

Up to 30% off Higherdose

The brand, known for its sauna blanket and wellness tech, is offering 20% off sitewide through Cyber Monday with the code BFCM2025. Bundles will be 30% off, no code needed.

Free gifts from Le Creuset

Today only, get different free gifts on $200 and $250+ orders with code FREEGIFT, plus enjoy free shipping on all orders.

Up to 40% off select Nespresso machines

The coffee brand will have some of its machines discounted for Cyber Monday, with up to 40% items like its Vertuo Next Deluxe.

Up to 35% off at Our Place

The Always Pan-maker has its entire website on sale at 35% off sitewide through December 1.

Up to $1,000+ off Samsung

The tech giant is having sales across categories, from its smartphones to gaming monitors, TVs, and tablets. For example, you can save up to $1,000 on its Galaxy Z Fold7 with a trade in, or $600 off without one. 

Up to 45% off Shark

On Cyber Monday, Shark will have new products up to 45% off with the code MONDAY15. Then, starting December 2, the promo will continue with an extra 10% off sitewide with the code CYBER10. Sale items will include its vacuums and viral ice cream maker.

Up to 80% off at Wayfair

Through Cyber Monday, shop of tons of deals across furniture, decor, mattresses, and more — including up to 80% off area rugs. Plus, everything ships free.

DashDividers_1_500x100

Best Cyber Monday Sex Toy Sales

Up to 60% off Dame

Subscribe to Dame emails to get access to deals and flash sales as much as 60% off.

Up to 40% off Honey Birdette

Honey Birdette has 40% off its best selling items, including sex toys and lingerie, for Cyber Monday. No code needed.

Up to 50% off at Lelo

The sex toy brand has discounts of up to 50% off its luxury lineup through Cyber Monday.

Up to 70% off at Lovehoney

Expect steep discounts on sex toys from Lovehoney on Cyber Monday. Everything from couples advent day calendars to bondage items and roses will be on major sale.

Up to 40% off Maude

Known for its discreet sex toys and elevated intimacy essentials, all of Maude’s products are on sale for up to 40% off through December 1. Save more when you bundle through the brand’s Ritual Builder.

Up to 65% off Womanizer

Through December 1, take up to 65% off select sex toys, including advent calendars.

Like what you see? How about some more R29 goodness, right here?
